attributes.action: investigate the legality of DRM measures in software, especially programs which are hidden from documentation such as SecuROM
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Games, such as software from The Sims and Spore series, have hidden software which is installed when the game is loaded into a computer. This is not removed when the game is uninstalled.

Specifically, SecuROM, has no mention of it's exsistence in the documentation.

Games from late 2008, including The Sims 2: Apartment Life and Spore, contain the hidden SecuROM and installs it into a hidden folder in the Application Data directory.

In addition to that, DRM is contained in the software, which only allows the game to be installed a maximum of 3-5 times. Effectively then, the consumer is only 'renting the game' as it becomes un-usable.
